Posts.Content: blacklab wrote: I just had reconstruction of my left breast after mastectomy.  I feel disappointed although I know I'm very fortunate.  A nipple-sparing procedure was performed on me.  I thought the implant would look fantastic.  Whenever I stretch my pec muscle, which is apparently quite a bit, the implant looks contorted.   Also, the chest above the top of the implant is concaved.  The doctor said they might be able to add something in a about a year, but is this normal?  Does anyone have problems with the pec muscle issue?  Thx. Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: Reconstruction after Mastectomy blacklab blacklab

Posts.Content: Apr 15, 2008 08:35AM blacklab wrote: Sounds like a win-win situation.  I appreciate this info.  I've maintained such a positive outlook throughout all of this yet felt so unexpectedly disappointed after the "unveiling".  Knowing the possibilities has helped me feel up again.  Thx.
Posts.Title: Reconstruction after Mastectomy blacklab blacklab

Posts.Content: Apr 15, 2008 07:35AM blacklab wrote: My plastic surgeon said there were things they could do @ about 6 months, but did not expound.  What do you know about fat injections?  I hope it sounds more painful than it is!
